issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: running compactor when there is nothing to do produces duplicate data

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
see example in HIVE-20901

 

Probably change logic in CompactorMR.CompactorMap.map() which creates delete event writer
fields.summary: Compactor produces a delete_delta_x_y even if there are no input delete events

comments.body: [~ekoifman] Hi Eugene. The root cause of it, that in {{CompactorMR.CompactorMap.map()}} we always create delete event write even if there is no input delete events. I've moved the initialization of this one, to the part where we are sure that we have input delete events. Also, added test for it.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12949037 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Failures are not related.

Actually, I just realized that there may some assumptions about delta and delete delta write ID ranges matching.  Let me check on that first.

Specifically somewhere in {{AcidUtils.getAcidState()}} or somewhere in {{CompactorMR}} where it figures out what files to include in compaction.

How it is related to producing delete_delta directory? As far as I understand, in  {{AcidUtils.getAcidState()}} we just get the delta directories and add them to the {{JobConf}}. Or I just misunderstand you?
Patch #3. Rebased on the latest master.
